Some insist sex addiction is real and demands attention. Others dismiss it as an excuse for cheating. Where do you stand? Is Sex Addiction Really an Addiction? 5 reasons why many experts refuse to accept that it's a true disorder.
Want to have more and better sex? 6 Reasons Why Married People Should Have Better Sex Lives. Much of what you've been led to believe about married sex is probably wrong.
Will having more sex make you happier? A new study has some answers. Could Having Sex Twice as Often Actually Make You Less Happy? New research may upend some long-held assumptions.
Worried that your sex life doesn’t live up to Hollywood ideals? Don’t be. Here's a better model. Is Perfect Sex Possible? Why realistic expectations can lead to greater satisfaction.
What are the real emotional risks of hookups? How Casual Sex Can Affect Our Mental Health. We're finally learning what hookups do to our psyche, for better and worse.
Too busy? Don't feel sexy? You're missing out, in more ways than one. The 5 Excuses We Need to Stop Making About Sex. Sex is more than just sex. When we let it drop out of our lives, there's a cost.
Make-up sex happens. Here's why. The Truth About Make-Up Sex. Research into the connection between conflict and desire.
We may enjoy sex, but do we really need it? Sex Drive? There's No Such Thing. A new book casts doubt on some cherished assumptions.

Is it true that the higher your number of sex partners, the less popular you become? Do Promiscuous People Really Have Fewer Friends? New research challenges stereotypes about promiscuity and shaming.
Pity sex happens. Here's why. The Many Complicated Reasons We Have Sex. Pity sex, charity sex, and other hookups with people we don't love.
Do we misunderstand people who enjoy casual sex? Does Wanting Casual Sex Really Mean Not Wanting Love? Challenging assumptions about those who seek hookups, and those who don't.
How often do we get distracted during sex? See what the research says. Why We Can't Stay Focused During Sex, and Why It Matters. Are you guilty of 'spectatoring'?

It's not what you fight about that matters, it's how you fight. Unless you're fighting about this. Is the Number One Relationship Killer Threatening You? Studies show that it's not sex, or infidelity. It's something much more common.
The new research on casual sex may surprise you. Which of Us Craves Casual Sex More? Diffrences in gender and attractiveness can impact desire, in some of us.
When it comes to sex, do more of us regret being too bold or too shy? It Seemed Like a Good Idea at the Time. Rethinking a sexual fling is normal—and the reasons we do are revealing.

When a man loses interest in sex, it often has little to do with his partner. Here's what's really going on. The 4 Hidden Reasons Some Men Don't Want Sex. Psychological insights into the causes of low male libido.
A new study overturns long-held assumptions about housework and sex. Do Couples Who Share Housework Really Have Less Sex? Research shows what actually happens when men start cooking and cleaning.
Is make-up sex better than not-fighting-in-the-first-place sex? Does Fighting Really Energize Your Sex Life? New research puts an old question to the test.
Has the one-night stand gone out of style? New research has the answer. What Type of Casual Sex Are People Really Having? Who do we hook up with? Studies find a potentially major shift.
Are you reluctant to talk about sex? Get over it. 9 Essential Habits of Sexual Assertiveness. Expert advice that can keep you safer and make you happier.

Our emotional reactions to casual sex are far from black and white. After a Hookup, Are More of Us Happy & Hopeful or Used & Confused? A new study identifies 4 distinct groups. Which best describes you?
Do women think about sex less, and reject casual sex more? Hardly. 6 Myths About Female Sexuality and Why They're Wrong. Research disproves outdated ideas about the female libido once and for all.
Our feelings and bodies can change. Our sex lives don't have to suffer. Is Something Getting in the Way of Your Sex Life? Don't shut down. Follow this advice.
Does your partner know what you really like? Why We Don't Talk About Sex. Expert advice to improve communication and intimacy.
Everything you thought you knew about sex may be wrong. Sex Isn't Rocket Science. It's Much More Complex. Get ready to radically rethink desire, marriage, fidelity—and hotel rooms.
Can you experience great romance without sex? One group says you can. The No-Libido Credo. The emerging understanding of asexuality may broaden all of our romantic imaginations.

When one partner longs for sex and the other doesn't, it's a crisis that demands immediate action. 4 Myths About Sexual Desire in Relationships. The truth about sex within couples, and tips to reignite the flame.
Do we have more hookups today than ever before? Is Casual Sex on the Rise in America? First-of-its-kind research delivers some surprises.
Have you ever regretted a hookup? After Casual Sex, Do We Feel a Rush or Regret? The research contradicts common assumptions.

Are you obligated to have sex with your long-term partner? If not, are they entitled to seek it elsewhere? Does a Sexless Relationship Justify Infidelity? Confronting a third-rail issue that challenges many couples.
Is casual sex good for your psyche? The research may surprise you. Are Hookups Psychologically Healthy? After the pleasure, there can be renewed confidence or profound regret.
We'd have much better sex if we just talked about it more. Why Aren't We Talking to Our Partners About Sex? Chatter about sex can be heard everywhere, except where it’s most needed.
Do you judge women more harshly for having casual sex? Is the Sexual Double Standard Going Away? Not necessarily, but it may be evolving.
If you're ready to learn something about your sex life, ask yourself these two basic questions. How to Think About Your Sex Life. Discovering new portals to more meaningful sex.
How many sex partners do people have before settling down? How many should we? Is it Good or Bad to Sow Your Wild Oats? How many premarital sex partners should you have?

Asexuals can experience love, passion, and deep admiration, but have no sex drive to speak of. What can we learn from them? Sex: The No-Libido Credo. Asexuals are complicating the traditional narrative of romantic love.

Romance, it turns out, can flower even when sex is out of the picture. The emerging understanding of asexuality may well broaden everyone's romantic imagination. Sex: The No-Libido Credo. Asexuals are complicating the traditional narrative of romantic love.
Intimacy might be considered to be the "nutritional value" of sex. Is junk sex as bad as junk food? On healthy life and healthy romantic relationships.

Check out PT's first cover story of the new year! 12 Rude Revelations About Sex. In order to transcend the discomfort that sex typically stirs, you may need to radically rethink desire, marriage, fidelity, and much more.
"Activities that increase analytical thinking can decrease religious belief." Are Sex And Religion Natural Enemies? Loving thoughts might increase religious belief, and sexy thoughts decrease it.
Sex can drive us to do things beyond all reason. But why? Sex and the Single Primate. A pretty face can lead men to take greater risks.
